meanings.definition: A small piece or portion of food left after a meal.
meanings.sent1: After dinner, the dog eagerly ate up the tasty scraps.
meanings.sent2: She always saves the vegetable scraps to make a delicious broth.
meanings.sent3: The scraps of cake on the plate tempted him, but he resisted the urge to eat more.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were like scattered scraps of paper, waiting to be pieced together.
meanings.sent5: The scraps of conversation she overheard painted a vivid picture of the situation.

meanings.definition: Discarded or leftover pieces of material.
meanings.sent1: The tailor collected all the fabric scraps to use in a patchwork quilt.
meanings.sent2: The artist created a beautiful sculpture from metal scraps found in the junkyard.
meanings.sent3: The scraps of paper on the floor made it look like a confetti party had taken place.
meanings.sent4: His dreams felt like scraps of fabric, waiting to be sewn into a coherent design.
meanings.sent5: The scraps of wood in the workshop held the potential for a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: A small, unused or leftover portion of something.
meanings.sent1: She kept the fabric scraps from old projects in case she needed them for repairs.
meanings.sent2: The gardener used the plant scraps as compost to enrich the soil.
meanings.sent3: The scraps of time left in the day were spent reading a good book.
meanings.sent4: His mind was filled with scraps of ideas waiting to be developed into stories.
meanings.sent5: The scraps of paper in his pocket held important reminders for the day.
